info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 07 at 9:03PM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM MONDAY TO 6 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Portions of the Panhandle of Oklahoma and the Panhandle of Texas. * WHEN...From 3 AM Monday to 6 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. Notify a friend or family of your travel plans. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. In Oklahoma, call 844-465-4997 for road information. In Texas, call 800-452-9292 for road information. Persons should consider delaying all travel. Motorists should use extreme caution if travel is absolutely necessary.
